page.title: 09Yarm Railway Connection
page.content:
{ THE GEORGE AND DRAGON PUBLIC HOUSE
There is a plaque on the outside wall of the building which reveals the importance of a meeting in 1820 to the development of railways. On February 12th, 1820 a meeting was held by the promoters of a railway between Stockton and Darlington ( as opposed to a canal ) The meeting was held in the George & Dragon by local gentry to arrange for a second bill in Parliament. The new bill passed easily through parliament and the first Railway Act has led to a world wide network.
